headerData: Jose Herrera is a Software Engineer.
Jose Herrera specializes in Solidity/EVM work.
Jose Herrera also likes to make neat websites

entries.title: Summary
entries.paragraph:
Jose Herrera is a seasoned blockchain engineer with a talent for transforming intricate protocols into streamlined solutions. With 7 years of experience mastering Solidity and Web3 technologies, Jose has been a key player in the blockchain revolution, crafting smart contracts and decentralized systems that push the boundaries of what's possible in the digital realm.

A graduate from a top Canadian university, Jose has been making waves in the blockchain world since the early days of Ethereum. From spearheading stealth DeFi protocols to advising innovative startups, he's become the go-to expert for turning ambitious blockchain concepts into robust, functional realities.

Jose's expertise spans the full stack, showcasing a comprehensive skill set that goes beyond blockchain development. He excels in crafting robust testing suites, ensuring code quality and reliability. His talent for software architecture allows him to design scalable and efficient systems that stand the test of time. Jose's technical writing skills shine through in his detailed documentation and planning documents, making complex concepts accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. On the front-end, he's proficient with modern frameworks like React and Next.js, creating seamless user experiences. His database work, covering both SQL and NoSQL solutions, rounds out his full-stack capabilities. In the blockchain realm, Jose is adept with Foundry and other cutting-edge development tools, implementing everything from AI-driven investment funds to on-chain governance systems.

When he's not architecting the future of finance, you might find Jose explaining blockchain to his houseplants or trying to convince his toaster to join a DAO. His passion for decentralization is matched only by his knack for making complex systems accessible to both developers and users alike.

In short, if you're seeking a Senior Web3/Blockchain/Protocol Engineer who can transform your most ambitious blockchain ideas into reliable, efficient code, Jose is the engineer you need. Just don't ask him about the time he tried to create a smart contract for his laundry schedule - some things are better left to traditional methods.

entries.title: Stealth Defi Protocol: Lead Solidity Engineer & Software Architect
entries.paragraph: Interpreted company requirements for AI-driven investment fund, wrote planning documents, implemented defi protocol, created unit test suite, collaborated with auditors, wrote launch strategies, and developed supporting microservices.

entries.title: ProductShare: Technical Advisor
entries.paragraph: Led technical infrastructure design, created microservices, developed smart contracts, managed token sale, and set up DAO for onchain governance.

entries.title: 4K.com: Senior Software Engineer (Web3/Solidity Protocol)
entries.paragraph: Implemented 4K protocol smart contracts, designed tokenomics and governance, created DAO, implemented reward system, and developed testing suite.

entries.title: Triple Point Liquidity: Software Engineer
entries.paragraph: Built platform for complex private equity transactions using private blockchain, worked on full stack development.

entries.title: Novera Capital: Lead Software Engineer
entries.paragraph: Led full stack development of all products, developed decentralized financial derivatives, designed software architecture, and managed devops.

entries.title: Polymath: Software Engineer Intern
entries.paragraph: Helped bring Polymath Dapp to main net and shipped version 1.3 with new features.

entries.title: Bull Bitcoin: Software Engineer
entries.paragraph: Created custom full stack software to increase Bitcoin adoption in Canada, focusing on banking/regulatory compliance.

entries.title: Adappcity: Blockchain Technology Advisor / Blockchain (Solidity) Engineer
entries.paragraph: Created software architecture for a decentralized art market based on ethereum and pioneered using NFTs to represent RWAs.

entries.title: Critical Mass: Software Developer Internship
entries.paragraph: Architected and implemented a scalable software project to automate marketing science activities and participated in the Citi FinTech CitiBlue reboot challenge.

entries.title: IBM: Business Process Management Developer Intern
entries.paragraph: Worked on developing and maintaining IBM's Business Process Management software and assisted in porting BPM to the cloud.

entries.title: Kings of the Cities
entries.paragraph: Conceptualized and developed Kings of The Cities (KOTC), an innovative NFT-based platform representing global city rankings. Implemented smart contracts for minting unique 'King' and 'Queen' NFTs for approximately 350 cities, integrated with DeFi ecosystems for treasury growth, and designed a token yield system with DAO governance. Developed the project website using Solidity and Web3 technologies, implementing features such as the minting process, token yield distribution, and DAO voting mechanisms. Successfully launched the project, opening minting for the top 50 world cities, and planned future developments including real-world partnerships and exclusive experiences for the KOTC community.

entries.title: Bitscreen
entries.paragraph: Created an IOT+blockchain solution for the digital out of home advertising industry. Users could pay ETH to get ads displayed on a physical screen somewhere in the world. Built on ethereum, solidity, nodeJS, and with IPFS.

entries.title: BlockVote
entries.paragraph: Ongoing project leveraging blockchain technology to allow distributed computing to solve security, anonymity, and verification concerns in traditional voting systems. Collaboration between IBM and the government of Canada.

entries.title: Entry 1
entries.paragraph: This is the first entry about a new project kickoff.

entries.title: Entry 2
entries.paragraph: Progress update on the ongoing development phase.
